page.title: 04Religion in East Leicester.
page.content: The skyline is dominated by the christian church spires. That of{St. {Saviour's Church}can be seen from almost anywhere in our D-block.Temples and Mosques are not so obvious,they are often in converted houses or factories.{St.Barnabas Church}was built in 1886, it cost Â£7000. There is a balcony where the servants used to sit during services. The church downstairs holds 60 people. On one of the stained glass windows there is a picture of a monk, this is the man who gave the window to the church. There is a pulpit and a brass eagle forms the lectern, people read on it. The fire-proof safe contains the registers for weddings,christenings and funerals.
